column5: 11/22/1963: Lyndon Baines Johnson is sworn in as the thirty-si…
column6: Lyndon Baines Johnson is sworn in as the thirty-sixth President of the United States following the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

column5: 11/27/1963: Johnson addresses a joint session of Congress call…
column6: Johnson addresses a joint session of Congress calling on legislators to fulfill Kennedy's legacy and pass civil rights and tax legislation.

column5: 11/29/1963: Johnson creates a special commission chaired by Ch…
column6: Johnson creates a special commission chaired by Chief Justice Earl Warren to investigate the Kennedy assassination.

column5: 01/23/1964: The Twenty-Fourth Amendment to the Constitution is…
column6: The Twenty-Fourth Amendment to the Constitution is ratified, abolishing poll taxes.

column5: 02/07/1964: The Beatles arrive in New York for their first U.S…
column6: The Beatles arrive in New York for their first U.S. tour.

column5: 03/14/1964: Jack Ruby is convicted of the murder of Lee Harvey…
column6: Jack Ruby is convicted of the murder of Lee Harvey Oswald and sentenced to death.

column5: 05/22/1964: In a speech at the University of Michigan, Johnson…
column6: In a speech at the University of Michigan, Johnson announces his intention to create a Great Society by extending American prosperity to all its citizens.

column5: 07/02/1964: Johnson signs The Civil Rights Act of 19…
column6: Johnson signs The Civil Rights Act of 1964.

column5: 07/15/1964: Sen. Barry Goldwater (R-AZ) receives the Republica…
column6: Sen. Barry Goldwater (R-AZ) receives the Republican nomination for President.

column5: 07/19/1964: Governor George Wallace of Alabama drops out of th…
column6: Governor George Wallace of Alabama drops out of the presidential race despite strong showings in several Democratic primaries.

column5: 08/04/1964: Three civil rights workers are found dead in Missi…
column6: Three civil rights workers are found dead in Mississippi. James Chaney, Andrew Goodman, and Michael Schwerner were all participating in the Mississippi Freedom Summer.

column5: 08/07/1964: Congress passes the Gulf of Tonkin Resolution givi…
column6: Congress passes the Gulf of Tonkin Resolution giving the President power to pursue military action in Vietnam.

column5: 08/26/1964: Johnson receives the Democratic nomination for Pre…
column6: Johnson receives the Democratic nomination for President. Senator Hubert H. Humphrey (D-MN) is nominated as the vice-presidential candidate.

column5: 08/30/1964: Johnson signs the Economic Opportunity Act, creati…
column6: Johnson signs the Economic Opportunity Act, creating the Office of Economic Opportunity and beginning the War on Poverty.

column5: 09/27/1964: The Warren Commission releases its report, rejecti…
column6: The Warren Commission releases its report, rejecting the notion that Kennedy was assassinated as part of a conspiracy.

column5: 10/14/1964: Martin Luther King Jr. is awarded the Nobel Peace …
column6: Martin Luther King Jr. is awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.

column5: 10/15/1964: Nikita Khrushchev is forced to resign as leader of…
column6: Nikita Khrushchev is forced to resign as leader of the Soviet Union and is replaced by Leonid Brezhnev.

column5: 11/03/1964: Lyndon B. Johnson is elected President of the Unit…
column6: Lyndon B. Johnson is elected President of the United States.

column5: 01/20/1965: Johnson is inaugurated President of the United Sta…
column6: Johnson is inaugurated President of the United States.

column5: 02/09/1965: Nine American soldiers are killed in an attack on …
column6: Nine American soldiers are killed in an attack on U.S. barracks in Pleiku, Vietnam. Johnson begins the bombing of North Vietnam.

column5: 02/21/1965: Malcolm X is assassinated by other black Muslims i…
column6: Malcolm X is assassinated by other black Muslims in New York City.

column5: 03/15/1965: Johnson calls for voting rights legislat…
column6: Johnson calls for voting rights legislation.

column5: 03/21/1965: Martin Luther King Jr. leads a march from Selma to…
column6: Martin Luther King Jr. leads a march from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama.

column5: 04/11/1965: Johnson signs the Elementary and Secondary Educati…
column6: Johnson signs the Elementary and Secondary Education Act.

column5: 04/28/1965: Johnson sends U.S. marines to the Dominican Republ…
column6: Johnson sends U.S. marines to the Dominican Republic to protect U.S. citizens after a military coup.

column5: 06/07/1965: The U.S. Supreme Court finds a Connecticut law ban…
column6: The U.S. Supreme Court finds a Connecticut law banning the use of contraceptives unconstitutional.

column5: 07/26/1965: Martin Luther King Jr. leads a demonstration in Ch…
column6: Martin Luther King Jr. leads a demonstration in Chicago in an attempt to bring the Civil Rights Movement to the North.

column5: 07/28/1965: Johnson increases the number of troops sent to Vie…
column6: Johnson increases the number of troops sent to Vietnam, indicating his determination to engage in a ground war.

column5: 07/30/1965: Johnson signs legislation creating Medicare and Me…
column6: Johnson signs legislation creating Medicare and Medicaid.

column5: 08/01/1965: A paper by Daniel Patrick Moynihan…
column6: A paper by Daniel Patrick Moynihan, entitled, The Negro Family: The Case For National Action, is released. The conclusions of the “Moynihan Report” create heated controversy.

column5: 08/05/1965: Johnson signs the Voting Rights Act into…
column6: Johnson signs the Voting Rights Act into law.

column5: 08/11/1965: The Watts Riots break out in Los Angeles…
column6: The Watts Riots break out in Los Angeles.

column5: 02/21/1966: Fearing that American involvement in Vietnam will …
column6: Fearing that American involvement in Vietnam will draw France into a world war, French president Charles de Gaulle announces that France will withdraw from NATO.

column5: 03/07/1966: The U.S. Supreme Court unanimously upholds the Vot…
column6: The U.S. Supreme Court unanimously upholds the Voting Rights Act of 1965.

column5: 06/01/1966: The White House Conference on Civil Rights urges C…
column6: The White House Conference on Civil Rights urges Congress to pass further civil rights legislation.

column5: 06/06/1966: James Meredith is shot in a March from Memphis, Te…
column6: James Meredith is shot in a March from Memphis, Tennessee, to Jackson, Mississippi; civil rights leaders organize to complete his march. During this demonstration, Stokely Carmichael makes a statement in support of “black power.”

column5: 06/13/1966: In Miranda v. Arizona, the U.S. Supreme Cou…
column6: In Miranda v. Arizona, the U.S. Supreme Court rules that the constitutional provision against self-incrimination applies to police interrogations.

column5: 10/1966: Huey P. Newton and Bobby Seale found the Black Pan…
column6: Huey P. Newton and Bobby Seale found the Black Panther Party in Oakland, California.

column5: 01/27/1967: A launch pad fire during tests for the Apollo prog…
column6: A launch pad fire during tests for the Apollo program kills three astronauts.

column5: 02/10/1967: The Twenty-Fifth Amendment to the Constitution is …
column6: The Twenty-Fifth Amendment to the Constitution is ratified, providing rules of succession upon the death or incapacitation of the President, and enabling the President to appoint a new vice-president in the case of a vacancy.

column5: 06/05/1967: The Six Day War breaks out between Israel and seve…
column6: The Six Day War breaks out between Israel and several Arab nations.

column5: 06/14/1967: Johnson appoints Thurgood Marshall to the Supreme …
column6: Johnson appoints Thurgood Marshall to the Supreme Court.

column5: 07/13/1967: Riots break out in Newark, New…
column6: Riots break out in Newark, New Jersey.

column5: 07/23/1967: Riots spread across the city of Detroit, Michigan.…
column6: Riots spread across the city of Detroit, Michigan.

column5: 10/21/1967: Anti-war demonstrators March to the Pentagon in an…
column6: Anti-war demonstrators March to the Pentagon in an attempt to shut it down.

column5: 01/22/1968: North Korean forces capture th…
column6: North Korean forces capture the U.S.S. Pueblo.

column5: 01/30/1968: North Vietnamese troops surprise South Vietnamese …
column6: North Vietnamese troops surprise South Vietnamese and American troops by attacking during the Tet holiday. While the Tet Offensive is not a military loss for the United States, it leads to a loss of confidence in the Johnson administration's prosecution of the war.

column5: 02/08/1968: George Wallace enters the presidential race as an …
column6: George Wallace enters the presidential race as an independent.

column5: 03/12/1968: Johnson wins the New Hampshire Democratic primary,…
column6: Johnson wins the New Hampshire Democratic primary, but anti-war candidate Eugene McCarthy comes in a close second with 42 percent of the vote.

column5: 03/16/1968: U.S. forces in Vietnam commit massacre in the haml…
column6: U.S. forces in Vietnam commit massacre in the hamlet of My Lai; hundreds of unarmed men, women, and children are killed. News of the event would not reach the public until November 1969.

column5: 03/16/1968: Robert Kennedy enters the race for the Democratic …
column6: Robert Kennedy enters the race for the Democratic nomination for President.

column5: 03/31/1968: Johnson announces a partial bombing halt and his u…
column6: Johnson announces a partial bombing halt and his unwillingness to seek reelection to the presidency.

column5: 04/04/1968: Martin Luther King Jr. is assassinated in Memphis,…
column6: Martin Luther King Jr. is assassinated in Memphis, Tennessee.

column5: 04/23/1968: Students at Columbia University take over several …
column6: Students at Columbia University take over several buildings on campus.

column5: 04/29/1968: Ralph Abernathy of the Southern Christian Leadersh…
column6: Ralph Abernathy of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC) begins the Poor People's Campaign in Washington, D.C.

column5: 05/13/1968: The United States and North Vietnam begin peace ta…
column6: The United States and North Vietnam begin peace talks in Paris.

column5: 06/05/1968: Senator Robert Kennedy is assassinated after winni…
column6: Senator Robert Kennedy is assassinated after winning the Democratic primary in California.

column5: 08/20/1968: The Soviet Union invades Czechoslovakia to end the…
column6: The Soviet Union invades Czechoslovakia to end the movement toward greater freedom and independence.

column5: 08/25/1968: Hubert H. Humphrey is nominated in Chicago as the …
column6: Hubert H. Humphrey is nominated in Chicago as the Democratic candidate for President.  Demonstrators and police clash in violent confrontations.

column5: 11/05/1968: Richard M. Nixon is elected President of the Unite…
column6: Richard M. Nixon is elected President of the United States, and Spiro Agnew is elected vice-president.

column5: 11/12/1968: Leonid Brezhnev announces that the Soviet Union ha…
column6: Leonid Brezhnev announces that the Soviet Union has the right to intervene anywhere in its sphere of influence. This “Brezhnev Doctrine” becomes central to Soviet foreign policy.
